title: What!?

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
I just finished the 10 placement matches for ranked, if you check out the link I think I did pretty well. 
But after they were completed my rank was bronze 3. I was expecting at least bronze 1 - silver 3 but for some strange reason I got way lower than what I had expected. 
I don't understand how mmr works :/
Please explain how it works. Thanks.

replies.body:
Thanks for the replies, I understand why I was placed in Bronze 3. 

Side Note, 8 out of the 10 games were duo games with a Bronze 5 and I understand that could've been a major impact on my account getting Bronze 3.

You did super well in your placements, congratulations!

At the beginning of each season, MMR endures a "soft reset". This basically means that it will take your MMR and lower it bit so when you do your placements, you end up slightly lower than where you ended (usually). 

From what I gathered on the boards at the beginning of season, if you won 7-8 games, you would get placed where you left off. Out of everyone I know, only one person ended up higher, and that is because he went from bronze to diamond during preseason. (This part is purely speculative, as Seph said, nothing official is released on how MMR works).

Last season you ended in bronze 4, so the pattern seems to fit.

Hey there,

Unfortunately there isn't much public information on the MMR system and most things you'll find are speculative.

From what I can gather looking up some info on your account (op.gg, etc) you did do really well in your ranked games, were most of them duo games? This can negatively affect your MMR (speculative) and place you in a lower tier (Or the complete opposite, depending on who you queue with).

op.gg estimates your MMR to be higher than the average for your division, this _should_ mean that you'll climb very easily, however MMR is all speculative.
